error.signature: failed to get cpu utilization: unable to get metrics for resource cpu: unable to fetch metrics from resource metrics API
error.regex: unable to fetch metrics from resource metrics API|failed to get.*utilization|FailedGetResourceMetric.*metrics-server

verdict.summary: HPA cannot fetch metrics because metrics-server is not installed, not healthy, or pods lack resource requests.

dead_ends.action: Manually scale replicas instead of using HPA
dead_ends.why_fails: Loses autoscaling capability â€” doesn't address the root cause

dead_ends.action: Switch to custom metrics without fixing resource metrics first
dead_ends.why_fails: Custom metrics require additional setup (Prometheus adapter) and are more complex

workarounds.action: Install or fix metrics-server: kubectl apply -f https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/metrics-server/releases/latest/download/components.yaml
workarounds.how: Check if metrics-server is running: kubectl get pods -n kube-system | grep metrics-server

workarounds.action: Ensure all target pods have resource requests defined
workarounds.how: Add resources.requests.cpu and resources.requests.memory to pod spec containers

leads_to.condition: when HPA can't scale and pods exhaust memory

preceded_by.condition: when basic HPA issues evolve into metrics API failures

frequently_confused_with.distinction: k8s-hpa-unable-to-fetch is specifically about metrics API unavailability, while horizontal-pod-autoscaler-unable covers missing resource requests
